artifact.content: User sends calls to another user
User receives calls from another user
Administrator needs to log in to use system console
Administrator needs to find an available phone number
System validates input of the administrator
Administrator adds a user to the system
Administrator finds available IP
Associate a phone number with an IP
Cancel a user�s service
Disassociate an IP and phone number pair, freeing them to use again
Disassociate phone number and IP from a user account
A cancelled user�s records must be retained in the system
Server can display the status of the phones
System has HW tests to run in order to check HW functionality
System alerts administrator if errors are detected
System checks for offline phones and reports to administrator
System checks for SW failure and reports to administrator
System checks for any corrections after failure and re-establishes phone
System is hung and automatically recovers to a default state after a certain period
Administrator can set the maximum number of concurrent calls
System must track all phone calls
Administrator can display a user�s bill through console
System issues bills at the end of each billing period
Administrator can display a specified user account
Administrator can update user account to reflect bill payment
Administrator can suspend the service of a user
Administrator can change the billing rate of billing plans
Administrator can change a specified user account
Administrator can change a user�s phone number
Initialize/set up a new phone
Assign a phone number to a user
Check if the customer exists, based on the phone number
Poll the phone for its status
List system errors & suggestions of which programs to run to fix/evaluate further.
Change the start/end time of the discount billing period
Change the length of the billing period
Print a user�s bill upon request
Print a user�s bill when his service is terminated
Announce a hardware failure in a phone
Modify the status of the phone
Press a digit on the phone�s keypad
Collect the dialed digits
Validate the phone number belongs to a user
Return the IP address that corresponds to a phone number
Validate that the caller can make outgoing calls, and the number is not blocked
Validate the callee is online to receive a call
Start billing users for their calls
Calculate the amount owing for a bill
Display a user�s bill on the screen
Create a user�s bill at the beginning of a billing period
The caller hears a message saying the number does not exist.
Find a user based on user data
Edit a user�s information
Administrator logs out of the console
Change the user�s originator/ receiver privileges
Add a phone number to the disallowed caller�s list
Add a phone number to the special numbers list.
Remove a phone number from the special numbers list
The caller picks up the phone and hears a dial tone
A user hangs up the phone
The callee picks up the phone to start a call
A tone is played (dial, playtone, busy signal, etc.)
A beep is heard by the callee while he is on the phone
The user presses �#� to switch to other line
The caller is forwarded to the callee�s voice mailbox
The caller is forwarded to the callee�s voice mailbox
A greeting message is heard by the caller
The caller can record a message for the callee
The caller cannot leave a message because the mailbox is full
A user can access his voice mailbox by dialing �1000�.
A user can delete his message by pressing the �7� button.
A user can replay his message by pressing the �3� button.
A user must enter a password before having access to his voicemail
That caller can now reach the callee
A user can delete his message by pressing the �9� button.
Any function can be access via the menu or a button (instead of command line)
One administrator at a time, with option to extend to multiple administrators
The maximum time it takes for the user to receive either a ring tone or busy signal should be 2 seconds
The maximum time it takes for sound to travel from speaker to receiver should be 500 milliseconds.
The maximum time it takes for the caller to hear the dial tone when he picks up the phone should be 500 milliseconds.
There must be a way to retrieve lost passwords.
The system should be backed up every night during a period where few calls take place
If there is a delay of 5 seconds after a key is pressed and the number is not complete, the call is timed out and a fast busy signal is heard
If the caller hangs up any time during dialing or while in the call, the connection is terminated
The callee is busy
Are performed every ten minutes to ensure system is in functional state
